Solar Sales Consultant

Company Name CSR Limited Company Location Scoresby, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 21 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Sales Consultant - Solar


CSR is the name behind many powerful brands, providing innovative and sustainable building solutions across the residential, commercial and industrial segments.


About Us!


CSR Bradford is a leading manufacturer and marketer of premium energy efficiency products and services including insulation, construction fabrics, ventilation products, photo-voltaic systems, solar batteries, and associated products and services. We operate from over 20 sites across Australia and New Zealand.


The Opportunity at CSR Bradford!


Our organisation is regarded as one of the best in the industry, and we back up our reputable name with Tier One products and a warranty that is unbeatable. We are currently seeking to expand our sales team and a rare and exciting opportunity exists for the right individual to join our expanding team. You will need energy and drive, and be passionate about providing positive outcomes for our customers.


You will consult, design and provide solutions that are tailored to our customer’s individual needs and budgets. You will be provided with leads from customers actively looking for energy solutions (solar, battery storage, and powered ventilation) across both the Residential and Commercial sectors, and you will follow up and work the leads and close the sales. \xa0


Benefits include a solid base salary, 12% super, 25% leave loading and a fully maintained vehicle. An incentive scheme is also included.


Your responsibilities will include:


  • Follow up on existing and self-generated leads to develop and close residential and project sales
  • Develop sales leads and maintain a database of potential and existing clients
  • Conduct sales meeting with perspective clients
  • Monitoring and regularly reporting on KPI's
  • Active feedback on leads on a daily basis


To be successful in this role you will need to have at least 2 years’ appropriate sales experience; solar experience is highly desirable. You will have a professional sales manner with a passion for ongoing development and training. Your communication skills will be exceptional, and you will have a work ethic where your follow up to leads is responsive and timely.\xa0


You will be committed to providing the highest level of customer service and adhere to company deadlines for follow up and reporting. You will be able to work independently and have the ability to work after hours and Saturdays.


This is a great opportunity to develop your career path and be a part of CSR; and specifically with CSR Bradford which continues to grow its product range. If you can grow our market while consistently meeting our requirements in our customer interactions via phone, email and site visits, we would love to hear from you.


Make CSR part of your future.


Apply online today or for more information contact Crissie Maloney on 03 8756 6847

\xa0

Finance Manager

Company Name Bastion Brands Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 217 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Opportunity\xa0

Bastion Brands is a boutique independent Health & Wellness marketing agency. We specialise in helping find the connection between science and emotion for some of the largest pharmaceutical brands in the world. \xa0We are seeking the appointment of a Finance Manager approximately 15 hours a week, based in our Melbourne head office in Church Street, Richmond. This is an exciting opportunity to join a team of 20 people, in a creative, positive and exciting agency that is growing fast. At Bastion Brands we love what we do and it shows.

\xa0

The Finance Manager role is critical, with a huge impact on the success of the business. The role will have many levels of partnership and influence both within and outside the business such as;

  • A close working relationship with the CFO and Managing Director, with weekly and monthly reporting
  • A supervisory role across the agency to ensure the team have adequately accounted for their time
  • A close working relationship with the account service team to ensure all purchase orders, quotes and invoices are being processed accurately and efficiently
  • A relationship with external suppliers and clients for the purposes of accounts payable and receivable

\xa0

This would suit a qualified BAS agent, with a min of 7 years experience. A background in advertising / marketing / creative agency environment and a good knowledge of the Job Bag (or very similar) system would be hugely advantageous.


Key responsibilities:

  • Accounts Receivable follow up in conjunction (with Account Management)
  • Accounts Payable management
  • Payments and receipts handling
  • Bank reconciliations weekly
  • Petty cash management
  • Credit card reconciliation monthly with assistance from admin manager
  • Expense claim management and payments with assistance from admin manager
  • Client invoicing - logging invoices in the finance system (with Account Management)
  • Monitoring of bank account and assisting the CFO in preparing cash flows weekly
  • Monthly payroll including maintaining all staff files
  • Quarterly superannuation payments
  • BAS and IAS
  • Monitoring of all job cost reports
  • Ensuring estimates, purchase orders and timesheets are all inputted correctly
  • Ensuring jobs are billed correctly
  • Liaison with Account management on cost issues and overruns etc.
  • Assisting the CFO and MD with monthly reporting requirements

\xa0

Other attributes:

  • Team player – great interpersonal skills
  • Firm but fair
  • Organised and efficient
  • Proactive approach
  • High level of detail orientation
  • Min 7 years experience in finance
  • Qualified BAS Agent
  • Knowledge and use of JOBBAG production and finance system would be a huge advantage.

\xa0

Culture and fit is a critical part of the success of Bastion Brands and we believe it is all about intent and attitude. These qualities represent the way we work, treat one another and service our clients.

  • B.B.P.O.D values; Bravery, Brilliance, Passion, Ownership, Determination

\xa0

If this sounds like you – please don’t hesitate to apply by sending your CV and Cover letter to our talent consultant Serrin Dewar at serrindewar@gmail.com. Note: due to the fact that we expect a high volume of applications, only successful shortlisted candidates will be notified.

\xa0

Production Manager - Iveco

Company Name CNH Industrial Company Location Dandenong, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 51 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Opportunity

We currently have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Production Manager to support our Manufacturing Plant in Dandenong and ensure the production operation runs reliably and effectively in line with business targets. Responsible for planning, coordination and organising production schedules, assessing project and resource requirements, this role requires someone who has strong analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to influence and ensure compliance at all levels.


Responsibilities

  • Understand the overall business strategy and direction and this to their area of responsibility
  • Ensure company assets (stock and machines) are protected and managed to achieve the maximum possible return
  • Balancing labour requirements to achieve manufacturing volumes
  • Cross Skilling of workers to ensure a sustainable work force
  • Ensure production units are assembled in accordance with schedule and material supply
  • Ensure production units meet manufacturing scorecard KPI’s (EH&S, Quality, Delivery, Efficiency, Absenteeism)
  • Identify and implement improvements throughout the Manufacturing Process
  • World Class Manufacturing (WCM) Autonomous activities (workplace organisation and autonomous maintenance) Pillar Leader – drive, manage and coordinate all WCM Workplace Organisation pillar team and activities
  • Support in the implementation of WCM across all other Pillars
  • Assess, treat and monitor hazardous substances and operations appropriately to minimise health and safety risks
  • Ensure compliance to Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) and Best Practise when employees operate equipment
  • Promote continuous improvement and process thinking


Requirements

  • Computer proficiency in Microsoft Office tools (i.e. Word, Excel)
  • 3+ years of relevant operation and production experience
  • Working knowledge of Lean Manufacturing Principles 5S, TQM.
  • Strong leadership skills and motivate a team of workers
  • Solid analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Basic mechanical knowledge e.g. ability to test & charge batteries
  • Strong ability to influence and ensure compliance at all levels
  • Technical background in the production area
  • Previous experience in manufacturing


Joining CNH Industrial means working in a dynamic and multicultural environment, in a lean and flexible organization that is open to new opportunities in emerging markets, with a strong focus on research and innovation aimed at achieving excellence at all levels.


Benefits

  • Productive and challenging work environment
  • A productive and challenging work environment
  • Competitive Remuneration Package
  • Onsite parking and subsidised caf\xe9
  • Career growth and Training Opportunities


If this sounds like the opportunity that you have been looking for, apply now!

Talent Acquisition & HR Advisor

Company Name HansenCX Company Location Doncaster, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 58 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Hansen Technologies is a global provider of billing solutions to the Utilities, Pay TV and Telecommunications industries. With over 40 years experience, software solutions in over 80 countries and 31 offices we are truly a global company. We are headquartered in Doncaster, Melbourne, 3108 (eastern suburbs) where this role will be based.

As our company grows we are looking to hire a Talent Acquisition specialist who is both passionate about securing talent to deliver outstanding customer solutions and interested in growing their HR career.

The APAC Talent Acquisition and HR Advisor will be an integral part of the team reporting to the HR Manager of APAC and working closely with Talent Acquisition colleagues in other regional locations.

This role will require you to be proactive in your approach and exercise self-management while cultivating a high level of engagement with business stakeholders. To be successful you will need to be experienced in managing timelines and expectations.


Responsibilities in this role will include:

  • Full recruitment life-cycle - Taking role briefings from managers across Australia, New Zealand and potentially our other Asian country offices, crafting job descriptions and advertisements, posting advertisements on job boards, screening candidates, arranging interviews, negotiating offers, carrying out background checks and producing contracts.
  • Onboarding - running orientation sessions for new starters and engaging managers to ensure our new starters are set up for success during their early days of employment
  • Assisting with HRIS administration
  • Assisting the HR Manager with local HR activities including appraisals, salary review process, salary benchmarking etc.
  • HR Reporting and audits


We are a close-knit team who often work outside our prescribed boundaries to get the job done. We are looking for a team player with an aligned attitude and work ethic who is ready to be a proactive contributor and participator.

If you have a minimum of 3 years of Talent Acquisition experience with some exposure to HR and you would like to continue to grow your career outside a pure Talent Acquisition role we would like to hear from you. If you have any questions please feel free to reach out to our team on 03 9840 3000. Please ask for Carla.

Desired Skills and Experience

Talent Acquisition, Recruitment, HR Adviser, Screening, Sourcing, interviewing, contract generation, negotiation, stakeholder engagement

864767861:
[

Senior Cyber Defence Engineer

Company Name nbn™ Australia Company Location Docklands, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 66 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


The Senior Cyber Defence Engineer is a highly skilled technical role within the nbn Security Group's Cyber Defence team. The role supports the team in gathering, maintaining and contextualising threat intelligence for nbn to prevent threats from impacting nbn's networks and systems. The role is critical in providing deep technical analysis of threats, assessment of vulnerabilities, cyber incident response and leading cyber hunting and automation activities.




A bit about your role


Outlined below are the core duties that the Senior Cyber Defence Engineer will be responsible for delivering:

  • Mature the Cyber Threat Intelligence capability by developing the threat intelligence platform.
  • Aggregate threat intelligence feeds and classifying them
  • Provide tracking, analysis and reporting of emerging cyber threats, both external and internal.
  • Extract network artefacts (static & dynamic) to enhance incident detection across nbn.
  • Have a thorough understanding and expertise in Cyber Defence frameworks (eg Kill Chain and Mitre Attack framework) and Information Security Management Systems.
  • Build and maintain threat intelligence sources and integrate with internal systems.
  • Lead the integration and automation of cyber defence capabilities with other Security processes including Threat Management and Cyber Incident Response.
  • Lead the Cyber Defence hunting activities to ensure a proactive approach.
  • Bring new insight and expertise to Cyber Defence (Artificial intelligence and machine learning).
  • Monitor and evaluate high risk threats and vulnerability alerts from vendors.
  • Analyse and profile threats in the context of nbn.
  • Provide written and verbal briefings to management enabling timely response to threats and vulnerabilities.
  • Ensure disciplined tracking and reporting of threat actors, targets and activity to management.




A bit about you


The successful candidate will possess an extensive track record in the field of Cyber Security and display a broad understanding of Security, IT and networking technologies and platforms and cyber threats. You will demonstrate experience in security operations whilst also being familiar with APT and other highly-resourced cyber attacks as well as retaining an understanding in Cyber Defence frameworks, e.g. Kill Chain and Mitre Attack.


Alongside the required technical proficiency you will also be expected to possess a highly consultative approach towards stakeholder management, capable of influencing senior stakeholders across the organisation and positioning yourself as a trusted advisor on Cyber Security.




Life at nbn


At nbn you'll be joining a team that believes there is strength in diversity and opportunity through inclusion. We're building an inclusive and diverse workplace where different perspectives, thinking and skills are valued and people are supported to achieve their potential. We're committed to our goal of increasing the presence of women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples in the business and have a focus on increasing diversity amongst our leadership teams.




Continue the conversation


If you think this role might be for you, we want to hear from you. Please apply by following the links and sending in your resume only. We do not require a cover letter or any selection criteria to be addressed.


nbn is a fast moving organisation with lots to deliver - so we may not always wait until the job ad expires before reviewing applications. As a result, you should submit your application as soon as possible!


At nbn our people and our planet matter. We have an unwavering commitment to the wellbeing and safety of our employees so that everyone goes home safely each day and can perform at their peak to deliver the nbn network. nbn also aims to build a network that minimises energy use and can be operated with minimal impact on the environment.

  • Information Technology and Services
